intro: Pedilonum navicula, commonly known as the boat-shaped moss, is a small, delicate moss species belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, boat-shaped leaf cells that give it its common name. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. It has a low-growing, carpet-like structure and is often found in temperate regions. Pedilonum navicula is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its resilience to environmental stress.
